title: Easy Slow Cooker French Dip Recipe
description: An easy French dip recipe made in the slow cooker that uses rump roast, beef broth, onion soup, and beer to create a delicious sandwich filling.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Main Dishes Sandwich Recipes Beef Easy Slow Cooker French Dip 4.6 (4,047) 2,895 Reviews 94 Photos A delicious French dip sandwich, perfect for the working mom! Nobody, not even teetotalers, have been able to detect the presence of beer in this recipe, but it adds a wonderful flavor! French fries make a great side dish, and they are good for dipping, too. Submitted by lonwolf32 Updated on January 22, 2025 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 94 94 94 94 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 7 hrs Total Time: 7 hrs 10 mins Servings: 9 Yield: 9 sandwiches Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 9 servings 4 pounds rump roast 1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle beer 1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed French onion soup 1 (10.5 ounce) can beef broth 9 French bread rolls 2 tablespoons butter Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Trim excess fat from rump roast and place in a slow cooker. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Pour in beer, onion soup, and beef broth. Cover and cook on Low setting for 7 hours. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Split French bread rolls and arrange them on a baking sheet; spread with butter. Warm in the preheated oven for 10 minutes, or until heated through. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Meanwhile, remove rump roast from the slow cooker and thinly slice on the diagonal. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Pile sliced beef onto heated rolls. Serve with sauce for dipping. Enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 4,479 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 612 Calories 30g Fat 19g Carbs 58g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 9 Calories 612 % Daily Value * Total Fat 30g 39% Saturated Fat 12g 60% Cholesterol 182mg 61% Sodium 456mg 20% Total Carbohydrate 19g 7% Dietary Fiber 1g 5% Total Sugars 1g Protein 58g 117% Vitamin C 0mg 0% Calcium 111mg 9% Iron 6mg 32% Potassium 543mg 12% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Easy Slow Cooker French Dip 01 of 94 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 94 Photo by  Chef Mo 02/13/2020 03 of 94 Photo by  holly 01/23/2020 Loved this. My family loved this. I don’t venture too far from my usual repertoire of the same 5 recipes, but I wanted to try something new. If I can make this, you can make this. I followed the recipe exactly as written, except that due to taking my 80 year old mom to her doctor appt and running the teen to youth group it was in the slow cooker on low for 7:35hr and on warm for about 3 additional hours. I figured it was doomed, but sliced the meat and returned to the juice for another hour while tending to the dog who just had surgery. Sautéd a yellow onion, toasted the open face of the buns in a skillet, added meat, layered the onions, put two slices of provolone on top and placed under the broiler until bubbly and browned. These words can’t out of my husbands mouth: “this is the best French dip I’ve ever had”. Paired well with Simply Lemonade & vodka. 04 of 94 Photo by  Jackie Sheehan 08/17/2019 05 of 94 Photo by  Angie Burroughs Dalrymple 02/03/2019 06 of 94 Photo by  Brian 12/16/2018 Very easy and very good. Easily 5 stars. I took the advice about what to add from others. A little salt, pepper, two crushed garlic cloves, Worcestershire, thyme, cayenne, rosemary, and a little red wine because it was open. 07 of 94 Photo by  Ymir Ayala 05/07/2018 08 of 94 Photo by  Jenifer Dean Parker 03/10/2018 09 of 94 Photo by  Patricia Grover 11/05/2017 10 of 94 Photo by  Gabriel Hagenbeck 10/05/2017 Fantastic and simple. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Slow Cooked Barbecue Beer Beef 53 Ratings Easiest Slow Cooker French Dip 207 Ratings Slow Cooker Philly Steak Sandwich Meat 112 Ratings Ultimate Steak Sandwich 143 Ratings French Dip Sandwiches 909 Ratings Marty's Loosemeat Sandwich 55 Ratings Pittsburgh Sandwich 21 Ratings Corned Beef Special Sandwiches 12 Ratings Spicy Roast Beef Sliders 1 Rating Sandwich Filling 8 Ratings E-A-G-L-E-S Swirl Sandwich 51 Ratings Mock Sliders 5 Ratings Chef John's Beef on Weck Sandwiches 20 Ratings Kansas City Style "Burnt Ends" Philly Cheesesteak 3 Ratings Classic Patty Melt 35 Ratings Beef on Weck 29 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
